    • getFinalNumberOfPlayers

      public int getFinalNumberOfPlayers()
      getFinalNumberOfPlayers() simply returns the maximum number of players in the game

    • getPlayerFromUsername

      public Player getPlayerFromUsername(String username)
      setFinalNumberOfPlayers() allows the host to change the maximum number of players allowed in the game. Throws an exception if the specified number is not in the range [2;4]. It can be called only one time public void setFinalNumberOfPlayers(int choice){ if(maxPlayerSet == 0){ if(choice > 1 invalid input: '&'invalid input: '&' choice invalid input: '<' 5){ finalNumberOfPlayers = choice; } else throw new InvalidNumberOfPlayers(); } else throw new RuntimeException("The number has already been set"); }

    • logPlayer

      public void logPlayer(PlayerColor playerColor, String log)
      method was changed in order to get iterate on colors instead of clients directly, because if more than one client were disconnected, there wouldn't have been a way to disambiguate what color to send the log buffer to upon reconnection
